result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell James Ptacek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 16CM24 and 16CM195

Provide DNA sample.
Agent to look at the facts of the case and make a decision if an AODA or follow through treatment is required.
No contact with Jenny Subject except to necessitate the needs of the minor child. 
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

10:28 Defendant Mitchell James Ptacek in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM24, 16CM195 and 16CM281 heard at this time. Thorie:  guilty to 16CM23, Ct#2 in 16CM24, Ct#5 in 16CM195. Dismiss Ct#1 in 16CM24, Ct#1-4 in 16CM195 and 16CM281. 2 year probation: No contact with Jenny Subject, except as authorized by the family court. AODA, court costs. Schwab and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Def pleas guilty to 16CM23, Ct#2 in 16CM24 and Ct#5 in 16CM195; Schwab stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of 16CM23, Ct#2 in 16CM24 and Ct#5 in 16CM195. Dismisses Ct#1 in 16CM24, Ct#1-4 in 16CM195 and 16CM281. Thorie and Schwab address sentencing. Def addresses Court. Court: S/W 2 years probation: 16CM23, Ct#2 in 16CM24 and Ct#5 in 16CM195; concurrent. conditions; No contact with Jenny Subject, except as necessiate the needs of the minor child. (16CM23) DNA sample and surcharge.  Agent to look into  facts of the cases and make a decision if an AODA or F/T is required.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

10:29 Defendant Mitchell James Ptacek in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM24 heard at this time. Previously the Court addressed the courtroom re: rights as a group.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Def pleas not guilty to charges in 16CM23 and 16CM24. Court rec/enter. OSullivan: 16CM23 $1000 cash bond remain. 16CM24 $150 cash bond. Def has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
